column4: <CaptainMorgan>: it can depend on the severity of the kernel updates that come out.  Usually I see about 2 & 1/2 per month, but if there are any important exploits that get patched, you can depend on the odd important one
lol wow i just reply'd myself :p
wow lol i just got that :)
it may tell of your chipset
!hello
man... i love this bot already, it helps me do everything i'm too lazy to do
yes I like it too... send it to yourself though with !ubottu | Dev_u_pper then you can !find and !search etc
ubuntu uses ath5k by default
correct.  I had it working but I went to madwifi for greater range and usability, frankly the ath5k isn't ready for prime time for a lot of cards
:we cannot infer that miguel1057 even uses a wireless card with an atheros chipset.  We need to know what card he has first.  For all we know, he may have a new intel card.
miguel1057 is you use lshw, it will probably show the card as Not Assigned or something like that.  Thus showing if the card is in fact enabled.
: aww... we almost had it :)
I think I was closer!!
: i was thinking he may have had a broadcom driver with a buggy antennae power control... it happens sometimes with newer cards
I see.  I was thinking how ath5k hates my orinoco proxim card since Ibex and how I finangled madwifi to restore it back to a fully functional card
yes, madwifi sometimes covers ath5k ... it is still in its ' infancy in 2.6.27
forgive me, baslphemy... i have used ubuntu's name in vain... 2.6.28 :P

ndiswrapper an option of course for vista drivers.  Ath5k is obviously the future, but it's not quite up to the support level of madwifi ...  oh man .27 I hated... I even tried my own custom kernel but madwifi saved me ;)

: well, i cannot say that i have parteken completely, I use gentoo to support/develop for all other platforms ... it makes dealing with the interdependencies and awkward version control actually manageable ;)
well, at least you're familiar with drivers and compiling
